speaker: Skyline
text: A monorail crosses the city skyline._  * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}     [_N.B. This episode originally had a subplot about Daphne trying to expand her physical therapy clientele, featuring actress Ana Gasteyer as a physical therapist observing the techniques Daphne used with Martin.  Director David Lee later said the subplot hadn't turned out as well as hoped, so the subplot was scrapped.  Gasteyer returned to play housekeeper Trish Haney in[ [10.07] "Bristle While You Work"](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_7/bristle_while_you_work_1.html), which was filmed after this episode._]  [_Act 1  Scene 1 -Frasier's Apartment Martin is lying prone on a gurney.  Daphne massages his hip._]

speaker: Martin
text: Ow! All right, all right, I'll talk!  Just make the pain stop.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, shut up.  I'm just trying to get the blood flowing.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, more like make me hemorrhage.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't tempt me.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, God, you broke something!

speaker: Daphne
text: Too bad it wasn't your bloody pie hole!  There, we're done, you big baby.

speaker: Martin
text: [_genuinely disappointed_] What, already? [_rising_] Oh, that felt great! Oh!  I feel like a new man.  I love your new table.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you're sweet.  Can I make you a sandwich?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that'd be great.  Yeah.  Oh, by the way, Daph, you know, they're showing the first-ever episode of _Rockford_ today. If you're really serious about becoming an American citizen, maybe you ought to watch it.  [_Martin sits in his chair.  Frasier and Niles enter.  Frasier is holding an envelope._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, now you've opened it.  That's mail theft.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nonsense.

speaker: Martin
text: What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing.  Just another piece of Cam Winston's mail has found its way into our box.  It's been happening a lot since we switched mailboxes.  Even after I gave the postman a stern lecture.

speaker: Martin
text: Especially after.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, it was an honest mistake.  Cam and I are on all the same mailing lists, and I'm sure mine is in his box.  Besides, it's nothing personal, look, it's just an announcement for some place called _La Porte d'Argent._

speaker: Martin
text: Probably just another froufrou restaurant or froufrou clothing store.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, this is not "froufrou," Dad, as evidenced by the manly scent of balsam.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking the letter and sniffing_] Hmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: They obviously deal with a very upscale clientele.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm.  Oh!  _La Porte d'Argent!_  Someone at the racquet club was talking about this.  It's very, very exclusive.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excitedly_] Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: That's all I know.  Some ill-mannered person started up his blow dryer before I could hear any more.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering from the kitchen with Martin's sandwich_] Hello!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne, Daphne!  Did I get one of these [_holding up the announcement_] in the mail today?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I don't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grabbing the announcement_] Poor Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: What's this about?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, they're all worked up about some smelly invitation Frasier stole to some place they never heard of.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_unsurprised_] Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but that's what's so intriguing, Dad, that there exists an exclusive place in Seattle that neither of us knows about.  [_Niles picks up the phone and starts dialing._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_rising_] It could be an art gallery, or a new haberdashery.

speaker: Martin
text: Or an Italian shoelace boutique.  [_Daphne laughs at this._]

speaker: Niles
text: What's happening?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a machine.  It's asking me to enter my six-digit access code.  What'll I do?

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't you just punch in whatever keys spell out "SNOBBY"?  [_Frasier glares at him._]

speaker: Niles
text: You know, it might be worth a try.  [_Frasier punches it in, listens, then grimaces._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, denied!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  The allure of the _Porte D'Argent_ has increased tenfold!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, here's our plan.  We go to the university computer lab, bribe some hungry hacker, and, once we've tapped into their mainframe, _La Porte D'Argent_ will give up her sweet secret like a blushing bride on her wedding night!

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't you just go down there and ask them what they do?  [_Frasier and Niles look taken aback._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad, that's a "Plan B".  [_Fade out._]  **PLAN B**   [_Fade in.  Frasier comes into the reception area, admires the stylish decor and then goes to the front desk._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.  Uh, is this La Porte D'Argent?

speaker: Receptionist
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, good.  Say, someone was asking me earlier today about La Porte D'Argent, and I had a difficult time characterizing it.  What would you tell him?

speaker: Receptionist
text: We try to discourage word of mouth.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's exactly what I said.  So, well, I'm here to take advantage of your offer.  [_He hands the invitation over._]

speaker: Receptionist
text: Sure.  Can I have your name, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Frasier Crane.

speaker: Receptionist
text: [_typing it into the computer_]  I'm not finding you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Try Doctor Frasier Crane.  Perhaps you've heard my popular radio show.

speaker: Receptionist
text: I'm not really a radio person.  I'm sorry Dr. Crane, you're not on the list, I can't let you in.

speaker: Frasier
text: But I have an invitation.

speaker: Receptionist
text: Yes, but you're not on the list.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but I do have an invitation!

speaker: Receptionist
text: But you aren't on the LIST.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, if I was on the list, I wouldn't need an invitation, I'd just say "I'm on the list."  Therefore, the invitation supercedes the list.

speaker: Receptionist
text: No, invitations are given out only to those on the list.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah-ha.  But you do concede that I do have a valid invitation?

speaker: Receptionist
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then it naturally follows that I would be on the list.

speaker: Receptionist
text: But you're not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Then how did I GET the invitation?

speaker: Receptionist
text: I really don't know.  You could have stolen it...  [_He returns to his work.  Niles comes into the reception area._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you accusing me of deception?  [_He notices Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Cam!  Cam Winston!  There you are.  [_He gestures Niles over._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_in a deep voice_]  Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, while I was waiting for you, I decided to test the mettle of this young man.  I'm pleased to report that he follows the rules of La Porte D'Argent to the letter.  [_He and Niles laugh heartily._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, I am a guest of Mr. Cam Winston's here.  He told me to meet him here, gave me the invitation and here I am.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I'm Cam Winston and he's my guest and I asked him to meet me here.  [_The receptionist checks his records, then hands folders across to them._]

speaker: Receptionist
text: Here you are, Mr. Winston.  Welcome to La Porte D'Argent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, thank you.

speaker: Receptionist
text: I hope you both enjoy your stay.  Take a moment to look over our services and I'll be back in just a moment.  [_He heads through a silver door and the boys look over the folders._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excited_]  Niles, it's a day spa!

speaker: Niles
text: [_still in a deep voice_]  Good gravy, this is fantastic!

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you stop talking like that?  That's the worst impersonation of Cam Winston I've ever heard.

speaker: Niles
text: You've heard another one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course not.

speaker: Niles
text: Then it's the best!  [_They take seats._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Now you're stuck talking like that all day.  [_The receptionist comes back out.  Niles and Frasier rise and he holds out cards to them._]

speaker: Receptionist
text: Here are your keys, gentlemen.  Your estheticians will be with you shortly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_booming_]  Thank you.  [_He clears his throat and talks normally._]

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  Oh, I've been waiting for that all morning.  [_Frasier gives him a dry look as the receptionist leaves again.  They return to their seats and look over their choices._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, the arovetic massage sounds splendid: two therapists at once, using hot stones and a blend of essential oils personally created for your dosha.

speaker: Niles
text: I think I'll have the aromatherapy Swedish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, look at this bounty!  Take a risk, be a man!

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking at the folder again_]  The chardonnay/rose hip salt glow?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now that's more like it.  [_An attendant comes out and hands them bundles with robes and sandals._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely.

speaker: Attendant
text: Right this way.  [_She leads them off._]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier!  River rocks and a stalk of wheat!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh.  [_They follow the young lady through the door.  Fade out._]  **AFTER THE RUBBIN'**   [_Fade in.  Frasier and Niles are putting their jackets back on after their therapies._]

speaker: Niles
text: I knew it was going to be good, but I had no idea it would be this good!  I feel like I've been rubbed by angels.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I just wish you had tried the vusattasen aqua-treatment.  I feel as if I'd had a rebirthing experience. I've never felt better in my life.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so polished my entire body is squeaking.  [_He shifts.  They step up to check out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello. Clerk:  How was everything?

speaker: Niles
text: Heaven.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nirvana. Clerk:  I'm so glad.  Now, this is a breakdown of your services.  [_She hands them bills and they choke slightly upon reading them._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Nirvana ain't cheap.  Well, it's worth it, I suppose.  What do you say we make this a standing appointment, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I think we owe it to ourselves.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. Clerk:  I'd be happy to set that up.  Now, I've also put together a personal La Porte D'Argent product system for each of you, based on the recommendations of your estheticians.  [_She hands them bags and they gasp in delight at the contents.  Frasier tries a mist spray._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, this smells great.  Try that. Clerk:  Ah, the mid-afternoon anti-stress spritz.

speaker: Niles
text: [_studying something_]  I've never even heard of eyelash conditioner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, hence the brittle lashes.  [_Niles brushes some on, then notices a man going through a gold door._]

speaker: Niles
text: Say, isn't that Senator Ogden?

speaker: Frasier
text: It is!  Oh, Niles, this just gets better and better. Balanced skin and social advancement all in one setting. I'm going to go say hello.  [_He heads over, but the Senator has already gone through.  Frasier presses on the door._]  Clerk:  I'm sorry.  That area is restricted to our gold level members.

speaker: Niles
text: You have a gold level?  How do you get in? Clerk:  You'd have to be on the list.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we ARE on the list. Clerk:  The GOLD list.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is absurd!  I am a member of every exclusive club in this entire town.  You must have a reciprocal membership with one of them. Clerk:  I'm sorry.  But you're more than welcome to enjoy the many amenities of the silver level.

speaker: Frasier
text: And just how are we supposed to enjoy this!?  [_He angrily sprays the anti-stress spritz in his face._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And this isn't working!  [_He stands there fuming as Niles applies more eyelash conditioner. Fade out._]  _End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment_  [_Fade in.  Martin is in his chair and Daphne is on the couch, watching TV._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You never told me Rockford was Maverick.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, technically he isn't Maverick in this, he's Rockford. Even though we all know he's secretly Maverick.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can see why you like this show.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, what's not to like?  Solving crimes, pretty girls, car chases...

speaker: Daphne
text: Leisure suits.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: Rockford's dad reminds me of you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_brow furrowing_]  What are you talkin' about?

speaker: Daphne
text: Rockford's dad.  You're just like him: cranky but loveable.

speaker: Martin
text: The hell I am!  I'm like Rockford.

speaker: Daphne
text: How'd you get that?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, come on: he solves crimes, I solved crimes.  We're both in tune with the beat of the street.  He's the kind of guy that men want to be and women want to be with.  When this show first came out, everybody used to say I was like Rockford.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, I don't see it.  You still remind me of his dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Rocky?  But he's old.  [_realizing the implication_]  Oh, I see.

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't mean that.  I just meant there's something about him that reminds me of you.

speaker: Martin
text: His oldness?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, stop it!  If you want to be Rockford, you can be Rockford, I don't care.

speaker: Martin
text: Fine, then let's just watch it.  [_They watch for a few moment, Martin quietly stewing.  Then he grabs the remote and turns off the TV._]

speaker: Martin
text: I don't want to watch this anymore.  Congratulations, you ruined Rockford for me.  [_Frasier and Niles come in the front door._]

speaker: Niles
text: I had a nagging feeling the whole time they were holding something back on purpose.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Blended for your dosha," indeed!  They wouldn't know my dosha if they fell over it!

speaker: Daphne
text: So what kind of hoity toity place did it end up being?  [_Frasier paces around as Niles goes to get sherry._]

speaker: Frasier
text: It was a hell-hole!  They had the nerve to call it a day spa, when it's nothing more than a mere front for a bona fide luxury spa which taunts those kept at bay outside its golden door!

speaker: Martin
text: If you didn't go in, how do you know it's better?

speaker: Frasier
text: It had to be!  The door was gold, ours was only silver.  Gold is better than silver.  [_He sits down as Niles brings sherries over._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_muttering_] Stupid silver.  [_He hands Frasier his sherry as Daphne rises and gives him a hug._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you'll always be in my exclusive club, honey.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thanks.  And that's all I need.  [_He sits next to Frasier._]

speaker: Niles
text: There must be somebody who can get us in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's go comb our Rolodexes!  [_They both rise._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, there has to be a way out of the slum they call the silver room.  [_Frasier heads to his room as Niles goes out the front._]

speaker: Niles
text: Why do I keep squeaking!?  [_He closes the door behind him.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier is sitting at a table.  Roz comes in._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.  Wait 'til you see this.  It is so cool.  [_She sits down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, I could use something to balm my wounds. Painful as it is, I've come to accept that I shall never pass through that spa's gold door.

speaker: Roz
text: Anyway, I was filing your new head shot...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes?

speaker: Roz
text: And I started looking at your old ones, I went back to when you first started?  [_She holds up a stack of photos and quickly flips through them, laughing.  Frasier gets a sour look on his face as she does it again._]

speaker: Roz
text: Woo.

speaker: Frasier
text: What am I looking at?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, it's like an animation of your hairline receding.  Isn't that great?  Okay, wait now, here's the good part: [_she flips them the other way_] it's growing back!  Receding... growing back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, all right Roz, that's enough!  All right!  [_He grabs at the photos to stop her.  Niles comes in._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, don't be so sensitive.

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, no good news, I suppose.

speaker: Niles
text: I've had no luck getting us into the gold level.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you guys really this bent out of shape over that gold spa?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Roz
text: Why can't you be happy with the silver one?

speaker: Niles
text: Gold is better.

speaker: Roz
text: Bull!  The only reason why you want to go there is because you can't!

speaker: Frasier
text: We saw a senator go in there.  A senator!  We elected him, he works for us!  How is it fair that our employee is admitted while we are shunted off to the icy depths of silver level?!

speaker: Roz
text: It's a spa!  How much better could it be?  I mean, are they gonna carry you around like a sultan?  You gonna be massaged by supermodels?  And what if you do get through the gold door?  What next, the diamond door?  And after that a titanium door!  And after that a plutonium door!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's ridiculous.  Plutonium's radioactive, no one's going to make a door out of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Although Roz does make a point, Niles.  What kind of fantasy are we chasing?  [_He sighs._]

speaker: Roz
text: See?  I'm right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I'm just imagining supermodels with that crook Senator Ogden.

speaker: Roz
text: It was Senator Ogden? [_laughing_] I know him.

speaker: Niles
text: You do?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, he really owes me one, too.  Want me to give him a call?

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you?  Absolutely!

speaker: Niles
text: How do you know Senator Ogden?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I knew him a few years ago when his marriage was on the rocks.  We kept it very hush-hush.  Thank God I knew CPR.  [_The brothers sit, digesting this.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Daphne is on the couch, thumbing through TV Guide.  Martin is in his chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Rockford's on.

speaker: Martin
text: Not interested.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on, it looks like a good one.  Tom Seleck's in it.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, those are good.  Not that I care.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I caught a few episodes at home, and I see the resemblance between you and a young Jim Rockford.

speaker: Martin
text: No you don't.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes I do.  No one gives him credit when he has a good idea. He likes to drive a little too fast...

speaker: Martin
text: He has my chin!  He knows how to work the system and the babes love him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes they do.  So what do you say?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, okay, why not?  [_He turns on the TV._]

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, this is good.  Sorry I got so worked up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you can't help it.  You've got principles, like Rockford.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, let's not lay it on too thick.  Oh, and look at that. Malibu, California.  FYI, those mountains you see in the background are the same ones you see at the beginning of MASH.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I love MASH.  Whenever I watch it, I think of you. Serving in Korea all those years ago, just like Colonel Potter.  [_Martin lets this sink in, then grabs the remote and shuts off the TV._]

speaker: Martin
text: That's it, go home.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Colonel Potter was old when he did Dragnet!

speaker: Daphne
text: Colonel Potter, that funny young doctor that used to mix martinis in his tent?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you're thinking of Hawkeye.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, that's who I meant.  [_Martin gives her a calculating look, while she looks back innocently. He reaches for the remote again._]

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.  [_He turns the TV back on and settles down happily.  Daphne sits back with a wide-eyed, sarcastic look at his willingness to go along._]  **DOOR JAM**   [_Fade in.  It is a plant-filled room with the sounds of running water and birds.  A woman wheels Niles in on a gurney.  He is wrapped up like a mummy and has a facial and cucumber slices on his eyes._]

speaker: Attendant
text: I've taken you to the relaxation grotto.  We'll just let the wrap and your orange honey-butter mask soothe you while you listen to the healing sounds of the Javanese rain forest, okay?

speaker: Niles
text: [_murmuring sleepily_] Okay.  [_She leaves him and passes Frasier as he comes in.  Blinking and shuffling in his robe, he runs into a potted tree._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, excuse me.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?  Frasier, is that you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I just had a, a color therapy treatment, my eyes haven't readjusted yet.  They sent me in here to relax.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm letting my orange honey-butter mask set.  [_They both sigh contentedly.  Frasier sits down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz was so wrong.  Completely wrong.  Oh, there.  My eyes are better.  Oh, Niles, you should see this place.

speaker: Niles
text: Be my eyes, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rising_]  Well, it's just paradise.  From the rare exotic orchids, to the trompe l'oeil sky, to the perfectly bubbled stream, to the...  [_He stands there, stunned at what he sees._]

speaker: Niles
text: To the what?

speaker: Frasier
text: There's a platinum door.

speaker: Niles
text: Platinum?  Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: Is it guarded?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  It's just brazenly standing there!

speaker: Niles
text: Then rip the cucumbers from my eyes and let's go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right!  [_He takes the slices off Niles' eyes and helps him sit up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  What are we doing?  [_He lets Niles fall back onto the gurney._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is exactly what Roz said!

speaker: Niles
text: No!  Roz said, "diamond door"!  [_He throws his legs over the side and manages to sit up, only to fall down the other way._]  [_N.B. During the filming of this scene, David Hyde Pierce fell off the gurney and hit his head on the floor.  He had to be rushed to the hospital, but no major injuries were reported._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, this is heaven, right here and now!  Why do we have think about someplace else?

speaker: Niles
text: This is only heaven to the people that can't get into the real heaven.  The platinum heaven.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, why can't we be happy?  Why must we allow the thought of something that at this point can only be incrementally better ruin what is here and now?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.  Let's figure it out on the other side!  [_He heaves himself upright again, only to fall to the other side once more._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  I am through chasing the eternal carrot.  Whatever is behind that door shall remain behind that door, unseen!  [_Niles thrashes again, finally managing to get up off the gurney._]

speaker: Niles
text: Stay if you want, I have to know!  [_He starts towards the door, but since he is wrapped down to the ankles, he can only take four inch steps.  Nonetheless, he shuffles rapidly and heads for the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh for God's sake, you can't even walk, you ninny!  All right, all right, I will go, just to take a peek.  [_He heads for the door as an attendant comes into the grotto behind them to change the water pitcher._]

speaker: Attendant
text: I'm sorry.  Sir?  You're not allowed through there.  Please remain in the relaxation grotto.  [_He heads out.  Frasier stands there, outraged._]

speaker: Frasier
text: "Please remain... in the relaxation grotto"?  [_Niles is heartbroken and almost sobbing._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Have crueler words ever been spoken?  Well, that's it.  I am determined to see where they think I don't belong!

speaker: Niles
text: Take me with you!  [_Frasier strides over, wraps his arms around Niles, lifts him up and carries him to the door.  He then kicks it open with his foot and sunlight streams into the room.  They gasp in delight._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Healing warmth and light!  It must be a magnificent solarium!

speaker: Niles
text: Goodbye sweet and edible facials, hello radiant life-giving sun!  [_Frasier carries him through the door.  Cut to - the other side of the door as the come through it, blinking in the light, letting the door close behind them._]

speaker: Niles
text: It's beautiful, it's beautiful!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  This is where we belong.  [_The shot pulls back to show that, rather than a solarium, they are in an alley behind the building, next to a trash dumpster._]

speaker: Niles
text: Do you smell garbage?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, Niles.  I don't think this is part of the spa!  [_Leaving Niles propped against the dumpster he pounds on the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello!  Hello!  Anyone in the relaxation grotto!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, look at all those bees.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bees?!  Niles!  Our sweet and edible facials!  Run!  [_He takes off down the alley.  Niles, still wrapped can only desperately shuffle after him.  Fade out._]
